instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dead
threads.message:
Hello,
This device came in for a flexgate repair but also had a reboot issue with a kernel popping up.
Ran Apple Diagnostics and got an error NDC001 - Camera Error.
Very difficult to check with opening the screen only 10-15 degrees.

Open the panel to check the board for corossion . it was clean.

But the machine wont boot now.
Only fan spin and trackpad click.

20V on Amp MEeter

PPBUS is at 13V

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dead
threads.message:
Camera flexgate problem has been reported for this model too.

Did you check USB activity and externa video?
What is CPU core votage, after 10-15s?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dead
threads.message:
No external video.
Where to check CPU Core Voltage ?
